title: Detected frames consistently lower than nframes
body:
Colab Notebook DLCv.2.1.8.2 or DLCv.2.2b5

Running analyze_videos with these calls: 

for v.2.1.8.2 
```deeplabcut.analyze_videos(path_config_file,videofile_path, videotype=VideoType,save_as_csv=True,get_nframesfrommetadata=True)```

for v.2.2b5
```deeplabcut.analyze_videos(path_config_file,videofile_path, videotype=VideoType,save_as_csv=True,robust_nframes=True)```

Detected frames is consistently lower than nframes. I don't believe this was due to metadata corruption (as was the case in issue #422), but I tried robust_nframes as well without resolution. 

Is there a way to identify which frames are lost? I need to sync the DLC output with my ephys timestamps (from Neuralynx VT1 file).  I'm not sure if its just trailing frames or if frames are lost at any point. Is there a way to identify which frames are lost? 

Here is example output when using DLC 2.2b5: 

```Using snapshot-242500 for model /content/drive/My Drive/DLC_analysis/ephys-Berkowitz-2020-09-18/dlc-models/iteration-0/ephysSep18-trainset95shuffle1
